elements.desc: (TEI document) contains a single TEI-conformant document, comprising a TEI header and a text, either in isolation or as part of a teiCorpus element.
elements.name: TEI

elements.desc: (abbreviation) contains an abbreviation of any sort.
elements.name: abbr

elements.desc: contains a summary or formal abstract prefixed to an existing source document by the encoder.
elements.name: abstract

elements.desc: (addition) contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the source text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.
elements.name: add

elements.desc: (added span of text) marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also add).
elements.name: addSpan

elements.desc: (address line) contains one line of a postal address.
elements.name: addrLine

elements.desc: contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.
elements.name: address

elements.desc: (abbreviation marker) contains a sequence of letters or signs present in an abbreviation which are omitted or replaced in the expanded form of the abbreviation.
elements.name: am

elements.desc: (analytic level) contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. an article or poem) published within a monograph or journal and not as an independent publication.
elements.name: analytic

elements.desc: (application information) records information about an application which has edited the TEI file.
elements.name: appInfo

elements.desc: provides information about an application which has acted upon the document.
elements.name: application

elements.desc: contains a formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text.
elements.name: argument

elements.desc: in a bibliographic reference, contains the name(s) of an author, personal or corporate, of a work; for example in the same form as that provided by a recognized bibliographic name authority.
elements.name: author

elements.desc: (release authority) supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for making a work available, other than a publisher or distributor.
elements.name: authority

elements.desc: supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, any licence applying to it, etc.
elements.name: availability

elements.desc: (back matter) contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text.
elements.name: back

elements.desc: (bibliographic citation) contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.
elements.name: bibl

elements.desc: (fully-structured bibliographic citation) contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present.
elements.name: biblFull

elements.desc: (scope of bibliographic reference) defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of page numbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.
elements.name: biblScope

elements.desc: (structured bibliographic citation) contains a structured bibliographic citation, in which only bibliographic sub-elements appear and in a specified order.
elements.name: biblStruct

elements.desc: provides encoded binary data representing an inline graphic, audio, video or other object.
elements.name: binaryObject

elements.desc: (text body) contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.
elements.name: body

elements.desc: contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work.
elements.name: byline

elements.desc: (canonical reference pattern) specifies an expression and replacement pattern for transforming a canonical reference into a URI.
elements.name: cRefPattern

elements.desc: describes a calendar or dating system used in a dating formula in the text.
elements.name: calendar

elements.desc: (calendar description) contains a description of the calendar system used in any dating expression found in the text.
elements.name: calendarDesc

elements.desc: (category description) describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.
elements.name: catDesc

elements.desc: (category reference) specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.
elements.name: catRef

elements.desc: contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy.
elements.name: category

elements.desc: (column break) marks the beginning of a new column of a text on a multi-column page.
elements.name: cb

elements.desc: contains one cell of a table.
elements.name: cell

elements.desc: documents a change or set of changes made during the production of a source document, or during the revision of an electronic file.
elements.name: change

elements.desc: groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.
elements.name: choice

elements.desc: (cited quotation) contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example.
elements.name: cit

elements.desc: (cited range) defines the range of cited content, often represented by pages or other units
elements.name: citedRange

elements.desc: (classification code) contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system.
elements.name: classCode

elements.desc: (classification declarations) contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.
elements.name: classDecl

elements.desc: groups together salutations, datelines, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter.
elements.name: closer

elements.desc: (correction) contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.
elements.name: corr

elements.desc: (correction principles) states how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the text.
elements.name: correction

elements.desc: contains information about the creation of a text.
elements.name: creation

elements.desc: contains an area of damage to the text witness.
elements.name: damage

elements.desc: (damaged span of text) marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible.
elements.name: damageSpan

elements.desc: contains a date in any format.
elements.name: date

elements.desc: contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer.
elements.name: dateline

elements.desc: (deletion) contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, or a previous annotator or corrector.
elements.name: del

elements.desc: (deleted span of text) marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
elements.name: delSpan

elements.desc: (description) contains a brief description of the object documented by its parent element, including its intended usage, purpose, or application where this is appropriate.
elements.name: desc

elements.desc: identifies any word or phrase which is regarded as linguistically distinct, for example as archaic, technical, dialectal, non-preferred, etc., or as forming part of a sublanguage.
elements.name: distinct

elements.desc: supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for the distribution of a text.
elements.name: distributor

elements.desc: (text division) contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div

elements.desc: (level-1 text division) contains a first-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div1

elements.desc: (level-2 text division) contains a second-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div2

elements.desc: (level-3 text division) contains a third-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div3

elements.desc: (level-4 text division) contains a fourth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div4

elements.desc: (level-5 text division) contains a fifth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div5

elements.desc: (level-6 text division) contains a sixth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
elements.name: div6

elements.desc: (level-7 text division) contains the smallest possible subdivision of the front, body or back of a text, larger than a paragraph.
elements.name: div7

elements.desc: (automatically generated text division) indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear.
elements.name: divGen

elements.desc: (document author) contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline).
elements.name: docAuthor

elements.desc: (document date) contains the date of a document, as given on a title page or in a dateline.
elements.name: docDate

elements.desc: (document edition) contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document.
elements.name: docEdition

elements.desc: (document imprint) contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page.
elements.name: docImprint

elements.desc: (document title) contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page.
elements.name: docTitle

elements.desc: (edition) describes the particularities of one edition of a text.
elements.name: edition

elements.desc: (edition statement) groups information relating to one edition of a text.
elements.name: editionStmt

elements.desc: contains a secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.
elements.name: editor

elements.desc: (editorial practice declaration) provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text.
elements.name: editorialDecl

elements.desc: (electronic mail address) contains an e-mail address identifying a location to which e-mail messages can be delivered.
elements.name: email

elements.desc: (emphasized) marks words or phrases which are stressed or emphasized for linguistic or rhetorical effect.
elements.name: emph

elements.desc: (encoding description) documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived.
elements.name: encodingDesc

elements.desc: contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start or end of a section or on a title page.
elements.name: epigraph

elements.desc: (editorial expansion) contains a sequence of letters added by an editor or transcriber when expanding an abbreviation.
elements.name: ex

elements.desc: (expansion) contains the expansion of an abbreviation.
elements.name: expan

elements.desc: describes the approximate size of a text stored on some carrier medium or of some other object, digital or non-digital, specified in any convenient units.
elements.name: extent

elements.desc: contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text.
elements.name: facsimile

elements.desc: (description of figure) contains a brief prose description of the appearance or content of a graphic figure, for use when documenting an image without displaying it.
elements.name: figDesc

elements.desc: groups elements representing or containing graphic information such as an illustration, formula, or figure.
elements.name: figure

elements.desc: (file description) contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file.
elements.name: fileDesc

elements.desc: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, which interrupts the text containing it at any point and after which the surrounding text resumes.
elements.name: floatingText

elements.desc: (foreign) identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text.
elements.name: foreign

elements.desc: contains a mathematical or other formula.
elements.name: formula

elements.desc: (front matter) contains any prefatory matter (headers, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body.
elements.name: front

elements.desc: (funding body) specifies the name of an individual, institution, or organization responsible for the funding of a project or text.
elements.name: funder

elements.desc: (forme work) contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.
elements.name: fw

elements.desc: (gap) indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.
elements.name: gap

elements.desc: (gathering begins) marks the point in a transcribed codex at which a new gathering or quire begins.
elements.name: gb

elements.desc: (geographic coordinates declaration) documents the notation and the datum used for geographic coordinates expressed as content of the geo element elsewhere within the document.
elements.name: geoDecl

elements.desc: identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase.
elements.name: gloss

elements.desc: indicates the location of an inline graphic, illustration, or figure.
elements.name: graphic

elements.desc: contains the body of a composite text, grouping together a sequence of distinct texts (or groups of such texts) which are regarded as a unit for some purpose, for example the collected works of an author, a sequence of prose essays, etc.
elements.name: group

elements.desc: (note on hand) describes a particular style or hand distinguished within a manuscript.
elements.name: handNote

elements.desc: contains one or more handNote elements documenting the different hands identified within the source texts.
elements.name: handNotes

elements.desc: marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or the beginning of a scribal stint.
elements.name: handShift

elements.desc: (heading) contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.
elements.name: head

elements.desc: (heading for list items) contains the heading for the item or gloss column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
elements.name: headItem

elements.desc: (heading for list labels) contains the heading for the label or term column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
elements.name: headLabel

elements.desc: (highlighted) marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.
elements.name: hi

elements.desc: summarizes the way in which hyphenation in a source text has been treated in an encoded version of it.
elements.name: hyphenation

elements.desc: (identifier) supplies any form of identifier used to identify some object, such as a bibliographic item, a person, a title, an organization, etc. in a standardized way.
elements.name: idno

elements.desc: contains a formal statement authorizing the publication of a work, sometimes required to appear on a title page or its verso.
elements.name: imprimatur

elements.desc: groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
elements.name: imprint

elements.desc: (index entry) marks a location to be indexed for whatever purpose.
elements.name: index

elements.desc: describes the scope of any analytic or interpretive information added to the text in addition to the transcription.
elements.name: interpretation

elements.desc: contains one component of a list.
elements.name: item

elements.desc: contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text.
elements.name: keywords

elements.desc: (verse line) contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.
elements.name: l

elements.desc: contains any label or heading used to identify part of a text, typically but not exclusively in a list or glossary.
elements.name: label

elements.desc: (language usage) describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects, etc. represented within a text.
elements.name: langUsage

elements.desc: characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text.
elements.name: language

elements.desc: (line break) marks the start of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.
elements.name: lb

elements.desc: (line group) contains one or more verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
elements.name: lg

elements.desc: contains information about a licence or other legal agreement applicable to the text.
elements.name: licence

elements.desc: contains the transcription of a topographic line in the source document
elements.name: line

elements.desc: (list) contains any sequence of items organized as a list.
elements.name: list

elements.desc: (citation list) contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind.
elements.name: listBibl

elements.desc: groups a number of change descriptions associated with either the creation of a source text or the revision of an encoded text.
elements.name: listChange

elements.desc: (list of prefix definitions) contains a list of definitions of prefixing schemes used in data.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using each scheme may be expanded into full URIs.
elements.name: listPrefixDef

elements.desc: supplies a list of transpositions, each of which is indicated at some point in a document typically by means of metamarks.
elements.name: listTranspose

elements.desc: contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.
elements.name: measure

elements.desc: (measure group) contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page.
elements.name: measureGrp

elements.desc: indicates the location of any form of external media such as an audio or video clip etc.
elements.name: media

elements.desc: contains the formalized descriptive title for a meeting or conference, for use in a bibliographic description for an item derived from such a meeting, or as a heading or preamble to publications emanating from it.
elements.name: meeting

elements.desc: marks words or phrases mentioned, not used.
elements.name: mentioned

elements.desc: contains or describes any kind of graphic or written signal within a document the function of which is to determine how it should be read rather than forming part of the actual content of the document.
elements.name: metamark

elements.desc: marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, typically but not necessarily indicating a point at which some part of a standard reference system changes, where the change is not represented by a structural element.
elements.name: milestone

elements.desc: represents any kind of modification identified within a single document.
elements.name: mod

elements.desc: (monographic level) contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. a book or journal) published as an independent item (i.e. as a separate physical object).
elements.name: monogr

elements.desc: (name, proper noun) contains a proper noun or noun phrase.
elements.name: name

elements.desc: supplies the formal name of the namespace to which the elements documented by its children belong.
elements.name: namespace

elements.desc: indicates the extent of normalization or regularization of the original source carried out in converting it to electronic form.
elements.name: normalization

elements.desc: encodes the presence of music notation in a text
elements.name: notatedMusic

elements.desc: contains a note or annotation.
elements.name: note

elements.desc: (notes statement) collects together any notes providing information about a text additional to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description.
elements.name: notesStmt

elements.desc: (number) contains a number, written in any form.
elements.name: num

elements.desc: groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter.
elements.name: opener

elements.desc: (original form) contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected.
elements.name: orig

elements.desc: (paragraph) marks paragraphs in prose.
elements.name: p

elements.desc: (page break) marks the start of a new page in a paginated document.
elements.name: pb

elements.desc: (postal box or post office box) contains a number or other identifier for some postal delivery point other than a street address.
elements.name: postBox

elements.desc: (postal code) contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail.
elements.name: postCode

elements.desc: contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter.
elements.name: postscript

elements.desc: (prefixing scheme used in data.pointer values) defines a prefixing scheme used in data.pointer values, showing how abbreviated URIs using the scheme may be expanded into full URIs.
elements.name: prefixDef

elements.desc: (principal researcher) supplies the name of the principal researcher responsible for the creation of an electronic text.
elements.name: principal

elements.desc: (text-profile description) provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting.
elements.name: profileDesc

elements.desc: (project description) describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.
elements.name: projectDesc

elements.desc: (pointer) defines a pointer to another location.
elements.name: ptr

elements.desc: (publication place) contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.
elements.name: pubPlace

elements.desc: (publication statement) groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text.
elements.name: publicationStmt

elements.desc: provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
elements.name: publisher

elements.desc: (quoted) contains material which is distinguished from the surrounding text using quotation marks or a similar method, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used.
elements.name: q

elements.desc: specifies editorial practice adopted with respect to quotation marks in the original.
elements.name: quotation

elements.desc: (quotation) contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.
elements.name: quote

elements.desc: indicates one or more cancelled interventions in a document which have subsequently been marked as reaffirmed or repeated.
elements.name: redo

elements.desc: (reference) defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.
elements.name: ref

elements.desc: (reference state) specifies one component of a canonical reference defined by the milestone method.
elements.name: refState

elements.desc: (references declaration) specifies how canonical references are constructed for this text.
elements.name: refsDecl

elements.desc: (regularization) contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.
elements.name: reg

elements.desc: contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it.
elements.name: relatedItem

elements.desc: supplies information about the rendition or appearance of one or more elements in the source text.
elements.name: rendition

elements.desc: (responsibility) contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility, or an organization's role in the production or distribution of a work.
elements.name: resp

elements.desc: (statement of responsibility) supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply. May also be used to encode information about individuals or organizations which have played a role in the production or distribution of a bibliographic work.
elements.name: respStmt

elements.desc: indicates restoration of text to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction.
elements.name: restore

elements.desc: contains a sequence of writing which has been retraced, for example by over-inking, to clarify or fix it.
elements.name: retrace

elements.desc: (revision description) summarizes the revision history for a file.
elements.name: revisionDesc

elements.desc: contains one row of a table.
elements.name: row

elements.desc: (referencing string) contains a general purpose name or referring string.
elements.name: rs

elements.desc: (speech or thought) indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters.
elements.name: said

elements.desc: (salutation) contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc.
elements.name: salute

elements.desc: (sampling declaration) contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.
elements.name: samplingDecl

elements.desc: describes a particular script distinguished within the description of a manuscript or similar resource.
elements.name: scriptNote

elements.desc: describes the principles according to which the text has been segmented, for example into sentences, tone-units, graphemic strata, etc.
elements.name: segmentation

elements.desc: (series information) contains information about the series in which a book or other bibliographic item has appeared.
elements.name: series

elements.desc: (series statement) groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs.
elements.name: seriesStmt

elements.desc: (Latin for thus or so) contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.
elements.name: sic

elements.desc: (signature) contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text.
elements.name: signed

elements.desc: contains a word or phrase for which the author or narrator indicates a disclaiming of responsibility, for example by the use of scare quotes or italics.
elements.name: soCalled

elements.desc: (source description) describes the source from which an electronic text was derived or generated, typically a bibliographic description in the case of a digitized text, or a phrase such as "born digital" for a text which has no previous existence.
elements.name: sourceDesc

elements.desc: contains a transcription or other representation of a single source document potentially forming part of a dossier génétique or collection of sources.
elements.name: sourceDoc

elements.desc: (speech) contains an individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.
elements.name: sp

elements.desc: indicates the location of a significant space in the copy text.
elements.name: space

elements.desc: contains a specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.
elements.name: speaker

elements.desc: specifies the name of a sponsoring organization or institution.
elements.name: sponsor

elements.desc: (stage direction) contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.
elements.name: stage

elements.desc: (standard values) specifies the format used when standardized date or number values are supplied.
elements.name: stdVals

elements.desc: contains a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.
elements.name: street

elements.desc: (style definition language declaration) specifies the name of the formal language in which style or renditional information is supplied elsewhere in the document. The specific version of the scheme may also be supplied.
elements.name: styleDefDecl

elements.desc: (substitution) groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text.
elements.name: subst

elements.desc: (substitution join) identifies a series of possibly fragmented additions, deletions or other revisions on a manuscript that combine to make up a single intervention in the text
elements.name: substJoin

elements.desc: signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason, typically because the original cannot be read because of physical damage or loss to the original.
elements.name: supplied

elements.desc: defines a written surface as a two-dimensional coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, zones of interest within that space, and transcriptions of the writing within them.
elements.name: surface

elements.desc: defines any kind of useful grouping of written surfaces, for example the recto and verso of a single leaf, which the encoder wishes to treat as a single unit.
elements.name: surfaceGrp

elements.desc: marks text present in the source which the editor believes to be superfluous or redundant.
elements.name: surplus

elements.desc: contains text displayed in tabular form, in rows and columns.
elements.name: table

elements.desc: supplies information about the usage of a specific element within a text.
elements.name: tagUsage

elements.desc: (tagging declaration) provides detailed information about the tagging applied to a document.
elements.name: tagsDecl

elements.desc: defines a typology either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.
elements.name: taxonomy

elements.desc: (TEI header) supplies the descriptive and declarative information making up an electronic title page prefixed to every TEI-conformant text.
elements.name: teiHeader

elements.desc: contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.
elements.name: term

elements.desc: contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample.
elements.name: text

elements.desc: (text classification) groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.
elements.name: textClass

elements.desc: (text language) describes the languages and writing systems identified within the bibliographic work being described, rather than its description.
elements.name: textLang

elements.desc: contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.
elements.name: time

elements.desc: contains a title for any kind of work.
elements.name: title

elements.desc: (title page) contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter.
elements.name: titlePage

elements.desc: contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page.
elements.name: titlePart

elements.desc: (title statement) groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its content.
elements.name: titleStmt

elements.desc: contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text.
elements.name: trailer

elements.desc: describes a single textual transposition as an ordered list of at least two pointers specifying the order in which the elements indicated should be re-combined.
elements.name: transpose

elements.desc: describes a particular font or other significant typographic feature distinguished within the description of a printed resource.
elements.name: typeNote

elements.desc: contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.
elements.name: unclear

elements.desc: indicates one or more marked-up interventions in a document which have subsequently been marked for cancellation.
elements.name: undo

elements.desc: defines any two-dimensional area within a surface element.
elements.name: zone
